intro: Leurocline mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritania leurocline, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom during the dry season. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
